title: NA60025: Ocean Engineering Vehicles - Quick Facts
text:
NA60025
Course name | OCEAN ENGINEERING VEHICLES
Offered by | Ocean Engineering & Naval Architecture
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 3-1-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution

Semester | {{{semester}}}

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Marine resources Types of ocean structures - fixed and floating. Offshore exploration vehicles. Different types of drilling and production platforms. Offshore support vessels; tugs, derrick barges, supply vessels, pipe laying vessels, salvage vessels, ocean mining vessels, buoys, mooring devices, marine risers etc. Use of submersibles and ROVs for underwater structures. Underwater inspection and repairs of structures. Transportation of ocean structures from building site to the operational field. Materials used for construction. General tests required for material testing.
